tool_description: Performs comprehensive trend analysis on weather time series data, identifying long-term patterns, seasonal trends, and statistical significance of changes over time.

timestamps.description: Array of chronological timestamps for the data series

values.description: Array of weather measurement values corresponding to timestamps

trend_method.description: Trend detection method: linear, polynomial, or seasonal

confidence_level.description: Statistical confidence level for trend significance (0.90-0.99)

detrend_seasonal.description: Remove seasonal components before trend analysis

smoothing_window.description: Moving average window size for smoothing (3-50)

parameter_units.description: Units of measurement for the parameter

error_messages: Array length mismatch: Timestamps and values arrays must have identical length.
Insufficient data: Minimum 10 data points required for reliable trend analysis.
Invalid confidence level: Must be between 0.90 and 0.99.
Invalid smoothing window: Must be between 3 and 50, and less than half the data length.
Non-chronological data: Timestamps must be in chronological order.
Invalid timestamp format: All timestamps must be valid ISO 8601 strings.
usage: Input time series data with timestamps and values. Configure trend detection method and statistical parameters to identify significant weather trends and their characteristics.

trend_direction.description: Overall trend direction: increasing, decreasing, or stable

trend_slope.description: Rate of change per unit time

trend_significance.description: Whether the trend is statistically significant

r_squared.description: Coefficient of determination for trend fit

seasonal_component.description: Whether significant seasonal patterns were detected

trend_summary.description: Human-readable summary of trend analysis results
